title: Create Variables
text: Let s represent the senior employee's earnings and $$n$$ represent the new employee's earning.
speech: Let s represent the senior employee's earnings and  n  represent the new employee's earning.
pacedSpeech: Let s represent the senior employee's earnings and   n

title: Translate Into System
text: Together they earn $43 per hour, translating into $$s+n=43$$. The senior employee earns $5 less than twice the new employee per hour translating into $$s=2n-5$$.
speech: Together they earn $43 per hour, translating into  s plus n, is equal to 43 . The senior employee earns $5 less than twice the new employee per hour translating into  s, is equal to, 2 n minus 5 .
pacedSpeech: Together they earn $43 per hour, translating into   s plus n, is equal to 43
. The senior employee earns $5 less than twice the new employee per hour translating into   s, is equal to, 2 n minus 5

title: Solve the System
text:
Using substitution we can substitute $$s=2n-5$$ into $$s+n=43$$ to solve for $$n$$, the new employee's earnings.
$$s+n=43$$
$$2n-5+n=43$$
$$3n-5=43$$
$$3n=48$$
speech:
Using substitution we can substitute  s is equal to 2 n minus 5  into  s, plus n is equal to, 43  to solve for  n , the new employee's earnings.
 s, plus n is equal to 43 
 2 n, minus 5 plus n is equal to, 43 
 3 n, minus 5 is equal to, 43 
 3 n, is equal to 48

title: Finding the New Employee's Earnings
text: How does the new employee earn per hour?
speech: How does the new employee earn per hour?
pacedSpeech: How does the new employee earn per hour?

title: Finding the Senior Employee's Earnings
text: Given $$n=16$$, plug in the known value to solve for s.\n$$s=2n-5$$\n$$s=2\times16-5$$
